citation.article-title: Diversity of grass-associated Microbacteriaceae isolated from the phyllosphere and litter layer after mulching the sward; polyphasic characterization of Subtercola pratensis sp. nov., Curtobacterium herbarum sp. nov. and Plantibacter flavus gen. nov., sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Plantibacter (plan.ti.bac'ter. L. fem. n. planta plant; N.L. masc. n. bacter equivalent of Gr. neut. n. baktron rod; N.L. masc. n. Plantibacter rod of/from plants)
Cells are Gram-positive, pleomorphic, non-motile rods that are sometimes arranged at an angle to give Vformations.
Cell wall peptidoglycan contains L-DAB, D-Glu, D-Ala and Gly, corresponding to type B2Î³, and muramic acid is acetylated.
Non-hydroxylated fatty acids are predominantly anteiso-and isomethyL-branched.
Minor amounts of straight-chain saturated acids are found.
Respiratory quinones are MK-10 and MK-11.DNAG+C composition is about 70 mol%.
